POAPin is a series of tools built on the POAP ecosystem. 

Since the Alpha round ended, we have developed a notification system for POAP. You will be able to receive updates on any POAP events you're interested in on any device. This feature will be launched soon. This would not have been possible without your help!


  ![POAP.OOO](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5019152/232519164-5504b031-3d83-47d0-b9e6-1c61c30e1d54.png "POAP.OOO")



Currently, POAPin has apps for Android, iOS, macOS, and a web-based POAP explorer. The basic function is to finely organize and share POAP. The web version also has the function of creating custom topics and grouping POAPs together. There is also pin.poap.in to create code to embed POAPs in web pages.

- iOS (Stable)  : https://apps.apple.com/app/poapin/id1607752693

FUNDACIÓN TUCULTURA fue creada en el año 2009 en Colombia. Su eje fundamental es el trabajo por la conservación, preservación, fortalecimiento, innovación y proyección de la cultura y ambiente colombiano a través de dinámicas de valoración y apropiación del patrimonio cultural y natural tanto en residentes como turistas. 

Para lograrlo ofrece los servicios turísticos necesarios a partir de la creación de destinos culturales impulsando turismo cultural sostenible.

Actualmente cuenta con servicios y proyectos que permitan apropiación y empoderamiento de comunidades para que hagan parte activa al desarrollo de territorio cuidado y protegiendo nuestro patrimonio inmaterial: 

Servicios: 

1.	Rutas Culturales Étnicas: Recorridos con contenidos turísticos, sociales, políticos y artísticos que demarca la presencia africana en Cartagena de Indias y los municipios del departamento de Bolívar.
-	Ruta de la Libertad : comprende una excursión etno turística por el corregimiento de San Basilio de Palenque (Patrimonio Inmaterial de la Humanidad)
-	Ruta Ciudad Mural Getsemani: Recorrido histórico cultural y político por el barrio del Getsemani viviendo y sintiendo le pasado, presente y futuro.


2.	Cartagena Revive la historia: Presenta la historia de Cartagena por medio de obras de danza y música.

3.	Proyéctate: Iniciativa para fortalecer los grupos culturales a través del asesoramiento en emprendimiento cultural y administración.

4.	Tu Evento: Realización y producción de eventos académicos y culturales sostenibles 

5.	Estudios TuCultura: Elaboración de investigaciones y publicaciones culturales

           Proyectos

1.	LimpiArte 
2.	Pedregazo calle de las tradiciones
3.	Festival del amor consciente 
4.	Sembrando Cultura 
5.	Corazon Verde
6.	Mi Centro es Cartagena 


POSTALES TUCULTURA: producto de marketing con cuatro diseños realizados por mujeres emprendedoras que lideran proyectos culturales en el departamento y representan el arte, la gastronomía, los juegos típicos y los habitantes de la Región del Caribe Colombiano.

Dentro de su experiencia destaca el apoyo recibido por Universidad Tecnológica de Bolívar como su primer cliente por medio de la Escuela de Verano, la Cooperación Española como segundo cliente con sus grupos investigadores. Tucultura en el desarrollo de un TURISMO CULTURAL SOSTENIBLE ha desarrollado propuesta de asesoría a grupos, iniciativas, ideas de negocios para el desarrollo de tejido empresarial competitivo.

Acciones a destacar

•	Formación en Cultura Ciudadana (ètica, valores, civismo y convivencia) a 400 miembros de las comunidades, con el objetivo de generar una valoración positiva de su identidad e idiosincrasia cartagenera y getsemanisense, de igual manera generar una valoración y respeto por el turismo y el medio ambiente.

•	Capacitación  técnicamente a 2000 miembros de la comunidad que participarán en el desarrollo de los producto de turismo cultural sostenible. 

•	Generar 200 empleos directos y 200 empleos indirectos en la comunidad, con el diseño, montaje y presentación periódica de un Espectáculo teatral, circense.


•	Generar 100 empleos directos y 100 empleos indirectos en la comunidad, con el diseño, montaje y presentación periódica de dos Rutas Culturales Étnicas, que incluyen artes plásticas y escénicas.

•	Creación y /o fortalecimiento de 200 microempresas de tipo cultural, artístico, comercial y turístico de forma directa y 200 microempresas de forma indirecta en el funcionamiento del Corredor Cultural. 

Actualmente Tucultura trabaja con diferentes entes a nivel local para el desarrollo de puesta en valor de los lugares a desarrollar turismo cultural como: Alcaldia, Asotelca, Fenalco, Anato, Acodres, Camara de Comercio de Cartagena 


Tucultura ha logrado acciones importantes que se hace reconocida a nivel local, nacional e internacional, la perserverancia, el compromiso, pero sobre todo el amor que tiene su directora Merly Beltran Vargas, la lleva a trabajar fuertemente con la sociedad para un TURISMO CULTURAL SOSTENIBLE 

Los éxitos reconocidos por Tucultura son:

-	PREMIO VALORES LIDERAZGO – Merly Beltran Vargas por su gestión y trabajo impulsando turismo cultural sostenible. RCN. 

-	Reconocimiento como proyecto de impacto social en Latam por medio de BBVA MOMENTUM 


-	Beneficiaria del proyecto INNPULSA actualmente hace parte del programa CRECE DE CAMARA DE COMERCIO E INNPULSA. 

-	Ganadora de beca de movilidad por medio de Agencia Española de Cooperación Internacional para el Desarrollo (AECID) y Organizaciones de Estado Iberoamericano OEI para la investigacion de turismo cultural en Cuba. 2010.


-	Reconocimiento como Actor de Trasformación entregado por Cámara de Comercio de Cartagena de Indias, por el éxito de su propuesta y el desarrollo de un turismo cultural sostenible. 2010


-	Reconocimiento de Secretaria de Participación y Alcaldía de Cartagena; como joven empresaria de la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias. 2010

[Metagov](https://metagov.org) is a nonprofit research collective. We build standards and infrastructure for digital self-governance. Our collaborations include: 

-   [Metagov Gateway](https://gateway.metagov.org/), an API gateway for digital governance services
-   [DAOstar](https://daostar.org/), the standards body of the DAO ecosystem
-   [Agreement Engine](https://law.mit.edu/pub/buildingnetnativeagreementsystems), a tool for building net-native agreement systems
-   [CommunityRule](https://communityrule.info/), a user-friendly governance toolkit for great communities
-   [Composing games into complex institutions](https://arxiv.org/abs/2108.05318), a research paper
-   [Constitutions of Web3](https://constitutions.metagov.org/), analysis and guides for DAO constitutions
-   [Cryptopolitics](https://medium.com/metagov/the-political-landscape-of-crypto-f440d521f411), a study of politics and ideology in crypto
-   [DAOchem](https://daogovdata.info/), a holistic view of DAO governance
-   [Govbase](https://govbase.metagov.org/), a set of research data sets in online governance
-   [Govbase Labs](https://metagov.org/govbase/), a weekly lab meeting
-   [Governance Experience Design](https://www.crowdwrite.xyz/metagov/cl7e9sjvc000q09jx9kjhbocz/text), a living manifesto for online spaces
-   [Governance Surfaces](https://github.com/notchia/dao-governance-surfaces), a tool for analyzing DAO contracts
-   [Groundwork Fellowship](https://metagov.org/open-call-groundwork-fellowship/), internet infrastructure design and marginalization
-   [LARP Governance](https://docs.google.com/document/d/e/2PACX-1vQZ_ROn1DBa_qi68PynATDH3ssK1D9xTH0DG5plp_vNuA3mUMD0Rl2jSG0Nlxy18ajVk6ZtMhnPFKAg/pub), speculative governance play, ethnography, and history
-   [MetagovDAO](https://metagov.org/metagovdao-call-for-proposals-research-community/), a funding body for research on DAOs
-   [Metagovernance Seminar](https://metagov.org/seminar/), a weekly seminar
-   [Modular Politics](https://www.metagov.org/modpol), a paper outlining a governance layer for the internet
-   [Modpol](https://modpol.net/), a governance mod for Minetest
-   [PolicyKit](https://policykit.org/), an engine for building governance in online communities
-   *(new)* [Redwood Parliament](https://metagov.org/redwood-parliament/), a governance convocation event
-   [Telescope](https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=4078259), a Discord bot for ethical, responsive digital ethnography
-   [Validator Commons](https://validatorcommons.org/), a cryptopolitical party of validators and allies

# Blockchain na Escola: Web3 Education for Brazil’s Public School Students

Blockchain na Escola (Blockchain at the School, in English) is a non-profit organization that seeks to bring web3 education to public school students and social movements in Brazil.

The first pilot was in the city of Serra, state of Espirito Santo, one of the most violent cities in Brazil, and you can check the results [here](https://blockchainnaescola.notion.site/Blockchain-at-the-School-Serra-ES-025b80a4acb54d7484b776bdd6e5b8ee).

Since then, our team has been growing and what was just an idea became a reality. We’re currently building a curriculum tailored for the public Brazilian classrooms.

We’re testing this new curriculum, our MVP, by training teachers so they can provide our content in the classroom.

That should allow us to gain scale faster, while limiting our costs and empowering teachers to replicate and adapt the content in multiple classrooms.

While education remains a hot topic in web3, we’re the only project totally focused on building content to be delivered in the public schools in Brazil.

This kind of massive access leaves us with the opportunity to spearhead the ReFi narrative while onboarding these new users to web3.

Our careful approach paid off and we’re already receiving tons of recommendations. In this short time span, we’ve accomplished:

* Presented our project to 8 schools
* Conducted workshops with 4 groups of teachers
* Presented in an open event for students at the Colégio Central (Salvador), one of the most traditional public schools in the city
* Scheduled workshops with 10 classrooms (starting May 2nd)
* Attended the Cripto Connect event in Salvador as a partner project
* Were invited to present in the Creativity and Innovation Festival ([FIC](https://fic.aprendizagemcriativa.org/pt-br/fic-salvador-2-edicao)), hosted by the Instituto Anísio Teixeira (in charge of teacher training in Bahia)

The results we’re collecting this semester will allow us to improve our content, teacher training methodology and course portfolio, making us prepared for expansion starting in July.

### Educational Methodology

Teachers and schools can select between our three course formats:

![|624x311](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/u/0/docs/ADP-6oF8bGRa80Ajzo6LAX65dzz9lyFreo9csHRyJ_6GWxTvvyPcaLG5fR7uOPkG80CICxd46EjwmY6bveICDZsz-MtTNanrpHonTmchzddyO4pSfhnv2ymKPiSra9COhfmRwLu7WNtFa5lXriD1AO3i9yaEEReA7qOJQzVl3DjZj7-PVDijPbuplewVedTDA5fAli7uA8tMafLKLGvdDEARURWun4OXDBGcDwhS9tR3LWZpAdTMh0g7UaE4GNDsei9a4c2TVsPW8jgNWqBfuKa8BtfDcBaz_va3JCyxnIm0SYH8AqS2gEya4JKKt-5VSfYTqKjmx0ob6Gwou7FQtX-5Wv8sJ4LEYZNcGQh-8gZoTF491nH5wtwHSdxjmShNDQST72zmU_61BaHRepCo8uxVMQJ1_PQ9Rg55ERRA8kXl4aSbefKtFyS_ORHm6yw9qGQk1VsPeXqQ_5YhVRKPlvaHqJe9DgTXdMloCs4YVgU2YYY76YOTLsHmlTDmKHLYvPqlw8yF7WIKfMwuEhRQpsLp5zTtdm8kyil7aeg99rXK8vvddCXJ-PKeOj2f-pc8zLN9nOyzeS1qwytDT1Yt1iWT0YX7h_wguUDD1SGERFmjyQL9j287HGmuKEeeGDTHkspLVlBKgybR7UV0boaLSUQEDwytkXScUsz5ZE_bgvybtrU4P2dy7ybADgOUCLsoPddOZQppTz3N1vSlWKh1-Xky6F2nkOtu7_fSXp0h_mEJ2tJ6QSpo8lp4Jm__IV5TOlrejiDoQxcpUcd1MfWAvnV3OBaVZjhXttc17QpTC4FvdGc_f4N1SEajG_h9COr9OWM2mDbua82gPL2yIXHL1nt1C1H1E3qzHUynTfFT4vK7-ZfamL7agH_6GCWuxLvbx17p9beqsEMj254pHzPzxEOqk99hznIi9vN4NZZWaciDu_qzuAlwQHWKHuI7tv9pi93DZsFg-ip5AOPtgY95YuHUyJcAsUe75qUpiYon)

Besides the format, teachers can also pick one of the following themes: Environment, Equality and Arts.

Our teaching methodology takes students to learn about the fundamentals of blockchain technology and how other projects are leveraging its capabilities to solve real world problems.

We select projects to address during class based on the chosen theme and provide hands-on activities for students to learn actively.

Based on the success of the 101.xyz experiment, we have also created short educational content for students to complete on their own. You can check our modules [here](https://blockchainnaescola.notion.site/Aprendizagem-Divertida-304f13d0368f4df9ab41177e50bbfb3d).

Our goal is to provide a gamified experience to incentivize students to keep up their learning with the $NOS educational token (no financial value) and NFT badges (as they progress through the game levels).

We initially planned to limit the activities to students, but will make the activities public on May 2nd to educate a larger audience. That will also allow us to collect results and improve the content faster.

### Community

It is also worth mentioning that we’re heavily invested in building a community with not only web3 and web2 projects, but also researchers, teachers and social leaders.

We’ll also reach students in Rio de Janeiro through our partnership with [Educar+](https://www.educarmais.net/). These initial experiences will also allow us to build a framework to onboard new partners to support our course expansion in 2H2023.

We plan to dedicate 40% of our funding request to our partners to show them how web3 is changing the funding game forever.

Our community is concentrated in the Northeast region, which could also allow us to expand the web3 footprint in a historically underserved part of Brazil.

## Scaling our Project: 60% of grant proceeds

### Project Expansion

For the second semester, we want to expand to at least 5 additional states in Brazil, reaching +1,000 through the course of the semester.

As mentioned, we’ll focus on the North and Northeast regions, which have lower economic development and a higher concentration of indigenous and black people than the South and Southeast, where the majority of the web3 industry is currently located.

The rationale is to expand the web3 frontier in Brazil while incorporating diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) at the core of our organization.

As we grow, we’ll also be laying the foundation to decentralize Blockchain na Escola’s management, so the community can gradually take the wheel to guide the organization.

That reinforces the need for us to incorporate DEI policies in our expansion strategy, to make sure we’re onboarding new leaders that’ll continue to represent the underserved communities we’re intentionally approaching.

### Building a Robust Course Portfolio

Our MVP portfolio prioritizes ReFi themes that have high demand from teachers and schools. However, there are other important themes in high demand in public schools that we’d like to explore.

Going forward, we’d like to onboard two additional teachers to the team to support us in training more teachers to expand our reach and to build a more robust course portfolio that can meet additional needs we’ve identified from schools.

We’ve selected themes that could allow us to further capacitate the next generation of web3 builders. Hence, for the second semester we’d like to include the following:

* Exponential technologies: artificial intelligence and blockchain
* Introduction to web3 programming
* Product development and design thinking for web3 projects

### Investing on Technology to Improve Gamification

As mentioned above, we’re testing our hypothesis that gamification can be a powerful driver to incentivize students to learn about blockchain technology.

The results we’re collecting will guide our decisions on how to properly tune the gamification to attract more students and improve learning results.

Provided we confirm our initial hypothesis, we plan to prototype an educational dapp in the second semester.

Our dapp will be lightweight and will run on the browser given limitations with internet bandwidth and phone memory for most students.

It’ll also allow us to introduce additional gaming features to increase students' emotional response to the game, which has been proved to be a major factor in [knowledge learning and retention](https://www.ascd.org/el/articles/how-emotions-affect-learning).

For our first prototype, we plan to include:

* Avatar creation, including cultural elements from African-Brazilian culture
* At least 2 Brazilian landscapes as the game scenario (one urban and one rural)
* At least 10 in-game levels
* At least 1 co-op game mode, where we reward students that cooperate
* At least 3 career paths that students can explore to prepare for their professional career

During the initial 6 months after deployment, we expect our dapp to reach:

* 1000+ unique users
* 100 monthly active users
* 50 daily active users
* 3000 completed activities
* Host 2 in-game events

We’re also partnering with AgroForest DAO on the Redemption Land metaverse project, which is currently focused in agroforest teaching. The collab is focused on two fronts: educational content and student reach.

## Ecosystem Development: 40% of grant proceeds

### Educational Projects

We quickly figured out that scaling web3 education in Brazil is not a mission for a single project. Luckily, there are a lot of awesome initiatives that are targeting education with a variety of methodologies.

We’ll use 40% of the grant proceeds to create a community fund that can be accessed by these partners. The goal is to accelerate blockchain education across multiple target groups.

We’d like to list them here to showcase our partner network in the education space:

* [Play4Change](https://www.play4change.io/)
* [Educar+](https://www.educarmais.net/)
* [Blcktopia](https://blckdao.notion.site/BLCKTOPIA-Home-e2faf8213d8b417b982986f3892520dc)
* [Neduc Coroadinho](https://twitter.com/neduc_social)
* [Elias Eduardo](https://www.youtube.com/@eliaseduardo.oficial)
* [Athena Metaverso ](https://www.instagram.com/athenainmetaverse/)

### Community and Product Development

We’re also looking beyond educational projects in order to foster the North/Northeastern web3 ecosystem.

Our experience at [Cripto Connect](https://www.instagram.com/comunidadecriptoconnect/) showed us how powerful an event can be in putting together multiple minds to solve real world problems using blockchain.

Our goal is to also use the ecosystem development funds to help drive the community’s growth along with its creator [David Costa](https://www.instagram.com/eusou.davidcosta/).

David has already put together an awesome community and we’re looking to build up on his efforts to make sure it can continue to grow and generate impact. More funds also means more events so we can onboard more people to web3 – here, again, we’re prioritizing DEI in our inclusion strategy.

Another pillar of our ecosystem development strategy is to cater web2 projects that could leverage blockchain technology.

We’re actively seeking such projects and helping to educate and inspire them to use web3 capabilities to bring transparency, speed and immutability to their apps.

On that front, the most notable opportunities we’ve identified are [Ayabese](https://www.linkedin.com/company/ayabese/about/), an incubator of social projects such as Afro Saúde and Minha Cesta, and [Cubos Academy](https://cubos.academy/), a startup focused on technological education for underserved communities.
